p: In this study, both formulations were prepared to have a pH of 5.0 to 5.5 and the pH measurements were done right after the preparations. In Figure 3, it can be observed that, under the 25 °C storage condition, the pH values decrease significantly from 5.56 to 5.38 and from 5.54 to 5.20 for the microencapsulated and non-encapsulated formulations, respectively ( p < 0.05) ( Figure 3a). Under the 40 °C storage condition, a reduction in pH values was observed significantly after 12 months of storage for both formulations ( Figure 3b) in which all values were below 5.0 ( p < 0.05).
